title: Auto-Pruning issue when datadir is placed in different filesystem then root
body:
I am encountering an issue with Nethermind’s auto-pruning functionality when the server has an LVM (Logical Volume Manager). According to my configuration, Nethermind should be activated when the available space on the filesystem that contains Nethermind datadir falls below 350 GB.
However, in reality, it appears to be checking the root filesystem (“/”) instead, which results in incorrect behavior. Below is the output of the df -h command for reference:
```
Filesystem            Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
tmpfs                 6.3G  2.0M  6.3G   1% /run
/dev/mapper/vg0-root   98G   23G   71G  24% /
tmpfs                  32G     0   32G   0% /dev/shm
tmpfs                 5.0M     0  5.0M   0% /run/lock
/dev/nvme0n1p2        2.0G  405M  1.4G  23% /boot
/dev/nvme0n1p1        1.1G  6.1M  1.1G   1% /boot/efi
/dev/mapper/vg0-home   40G  1.1G   36G   3% /home
/dev/mapper/vg0-node  3.5T  652G  2.7T  20% /mnt/operational
tmpfs                 6.3G  4.0K  6.3G   1% /run/user/1000
```
As per the configuration, Nethermind should focus on the /mnt/operational filesystem, where the Nethermind datadir is located, and trigger when the available space reaches or falls below 350 GB. However, it currently appears to monitor the root filesystem (“/”) instead.
Configuration:
```
ExecStart=/usr/bin/nethermind --config=mainnet --datadir=/mnt/operational/nethermind --Sync.AncientBodiesBarrier 11052984 --Sync.AncientReceiptsBarrier 11052984 --JsonRpc.JwtSecretFile=/mnt/operational/jwt/jwt.hex --JsonRpc.AdditionalRpcUrls http://127.0.0.1:1337/|http|admin --JsonRpc.EnginePort 8551  --JsonRpc.Enabled=true --JsonRpc.EngineHost=0.0.0.0 --JsonRpc.Host=0.0.0.0 --Metrics.Enabled=true --Metrics.ExposePort=7070 --EthStats.Server=0.0.0.0 --Pruning.FullPruningCompletionBehavior AlwaysShutdown --Pruning.FullPruningTrigger=VolumeFreeSpace --Pruning.FullPruningThresholdMb=375810 --Pruning.FullPruningMaxDegreeOfParallelism 4 --Pruning.FullPruningMemoryBudgetMb=16384
```
Versions:
```
Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
Nethermind Version: 1.20.4+d06ec791
```
This issue is impacting the correct operation of Nethermind’s auto-pruning functionality. Any assistance in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.
